description: Self Assessment transactions include form submissions, amended submissions and registrations.
title: Self Assessment transactions
description-extra: Self Assessment is the process for the self-employed, higher earners and those with more complicated affairs that cannot be serviced through the PAYE system to calculate their tax liability and declare any income tax due. The online service provides a view of customers' liabilities and payments and designatory information.
costs:
1.Transaction and cost numbers have been collected using current year outturn data. Variations from baseline 2011-12 costs have been driven by changing volumes, investment and efficiencies already in train.
2. Unit cost data has been constructed using paybill data, with a 23% uplift for overheads. HMRC's costing framework is in development and 2011-12 data have been updated with a more accurate reflection of volumes and costs. Changes are in train to improve the accuracy of estates and IT cost apportionment.
3. Assumptions have been made about the balance of cost for transactional and enforcement/ other activity where business units mix both.
4. Additional IT investment to facilitate digital may alter the cost balance, with additional depreciation charges increasing online cost.
other-notes: Over the next two years HMRC will introduce Digital SA, an online service for ten million Self Assessment customers that will simplify processes, and significantly reduce paperwork.

modules.title: Transactions per quarter
modules.description: Total number of transactions each quarter
info: Data source: HM Revenue and Customs
